docs.summary: The Members API provides functionality for managing group members, inluding adding, removing, and querying group members.
description: The Members API provides functionality for managing group members, inluding adding, removing, and querying group members.
To enable groups backend API functionality for your site, add the [Wix Groups](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-groups-adding-and-setting-up-wix-groups) application to your site.
### Settings for Typical Use Case
+ Group members with group `admin` permissions determine whether all group members can add additional members to their group.
+ This setting can be found in your site's Dashboard under **Groups Application > Your Group > Admin Tools > Member Permissions**.
+ If set to all members, group members can add additional members to the group using the [`addGroupMembers()`](wix-groups-backend.Members/addGroupMembers) function (no approval required).
+ If set to admins only, only admins can add additional members to the group using the `addGroupMembers()` function.
The Members API provides functionality allowing you to:
+ [Add](wix-groups-backend.Members/addgroupmembers) members to a group.
+ [List](wix-groups-backend.Members/listgroupmembers) all members of a group.
+ [List](wix-groups-backend.Members/listmemberships) a site member's group memberships.
+ [Query](wix-groups-backend.Members/querygroupmembers) members of a group.
+ [Query](wix-groups-backend.Members/querymemberships) a site member's group memberships.
+ [Remove](wix-groups-backend.Members/removegroupmembers) members of a group.
Permissions Information:
|Functions|Permissions
| `addGroupMembers()`|Manage in your site's Dashboard
| `removeGroupMembers()`|Site admin, Group admin

| `listGroupMembers()`, `listMemberships()`, `queryGroupMembers()`, `queryMemberships()`|For public & private groups: Any site member
For secret groups: Group members, Site admin, Group admin
```javascript
import { members } from "wix-groups-backend";

docs.summary: Adds site members to a group.
description: The `addGroupMembers()` function returns a Promise that resolves to the newly-added group member
after the member has successfully been added.
Only site admins, and group members with group `admin` permissions can add new members to their group. They can also choose to allow all group members to add a new member to the group.
This setting can be found in your site's Dashboard under **Groups Application > Your Group > Admin Tools > Member Permissions**.

examples.title: Add site members to a group

docs.summary: Lists all members of a group.
description: The `listGroupMembers()` function returns a Promise that resolves to a list of up to 100 group members.
Sorts by default to `joinedDate` in descending order.

examples.title: List all site members in a group

docs.summary: Lists all group memberships of a site member.
description: The `listMemberships()` function returns a Promise that resolves to a list of up to 100 group memberships.

examples.title: List all group memberships of a site member

ret.doc: A `MembersQueryBuilder` object that contains the refined query.

docs.summary: Retrieves a list of up to 100 group members, given the provided paging, sorting and filtering.
description: Creates a query to retrieve a list of group members.
The `queryGroupMembers()` function builds a query to retrieve a list of all group members, and returns a [MembersQueryBuilder](wix-groups-backend.Members/membersquerybuilder) object.
The returned object contains the query definition which is typically used to run the query using the [`find()`](wix-groups-backend.Members/membersquerybuilder/find) function.
You can refine the query by chaining `MembersQueryBuilder` functions onto the query. `MembersQueryBuilder` functions enable you to sort, filter, and control the results that `queryMembers()` returns.
`queryGroupMembers` runs with these `MembersQueryBuilder` defaults, which you can override:
+ [`limit(100)`](wix-groups-backend/members/membersquerybuilder/limit)
+ [`descending("joinedDate")`](wix-groups-backend/members/membersquerybuilder/descending)
The following `MembersQueryBuilder` functions are supported for `queryGroupMembers()`.

| Property                    | Supported Filters & Sorting                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |

| `status`                    | [`eq()`](wix-groups-backend.Members/membersquerybuilder/eq), [`ne()`](wix-groups-backend.Members/membersquerybuilder/ne), [`hasSome()`](wix-groups-backend.Members/membersquerybuilder/hasSome)                                |

ret.doc: A `MembersQueryBuilder` object that contains the refined query.

docs.summary: Retrieves a list of up to 100 memberships, given the provided paging, sorting and filtering.
description: Creates a query to retrieve a list of memberships.
The `queryMemberships()` function builds a query to retrieve a list of all memberships, and returns a [MembersQueryBuilder](wix-groups-backend.Members/membersquerybuilder) object.
The returned object contains the query definition which is typically used to run the query using the [`find()`](wix-groups-backend.Members/membersquerybuilder/find) function.

You can refine the query by chaining `MembersQueryBuilder` functions onto the query. `MembersQueryBuilder` functions enable you to sort, filter, and control the results that `queryMemberships()` returns.
`queryMemberships` runs with these `MembersQueryBuilder` defaults, which you can override:
+ [`limit(100)`](wix-groups-backend/members/membersquerybuilder/limit)
+ [`ascending("joinedDate")`](wix-groups-backend/members/membersquerybuilder/ascending)
The following `MembersQueryBuilder` functions are supported for `queryMemberships()`.

| Property                    | Supported Filters & Sorting                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |

| `status`                    | [`eq()`](wix-groups-backend.Members/membersquerybuilder/eq), [`ne()`](wix-groups-backend.Members/membersquerybuilder/ne), [`hasSome()`](wix-groups-backend.Members/membersquerybuilder/hasSome)                               |
The `removeGroupMembers()` function returns a Promise that resolves when the member is removed from the group.
Only site admins, and group members with group `admin` permissions can remove members from their group.

examples.title: Remove a site member from a group

members.name: role
members.doc:
Group member role.
One of:
- `"MEMBER"`: Group member.
- `"ADMIN"`: Group member with admin permissions.

members.name: memberId
members.doc: Site member ID of group member.

members.name: joinedDate
members.doc: Date and time the group member joined the group.

members.name: memberIds
members.doc: IDs of the site members to add to the group.

members.name: memberIds
members.doc: IDs of the site members to remove from the group.

members.name: role
members.doc:
Group member role. 
One of:
- `"MEMBER"`: Group member.
- `"ADMIN"`: Group member with admin permissions.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Maximum number of memberships to retrieve. Defaults to 100.

members.name: skip
members.doc: Number of memberships to skip in the list.
